maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of a single Event Hub, or gets a list of Event Hubs.

The Get-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet returns either the details of an Event Hub, or a list of all Event Hubs in the current namespace. If the Event Hub name is provided, the details of a single Event Hub are returned. If an Event Hub name is not provided, a list of all Event Hubs in the specified namespace is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Determine the maximum number of EventHubs to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Determine the maximum number of EventHubs to return.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - specified EventHub
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the details of the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 - List of EventHub in specified Namespace
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a list of Event Hubs in the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an authorization rule, or gets a list of authorization rules.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet gets either the details of an authorization rule, or a list of all authorization rules for a specified Event Hub. If the name of an authorization rule is provided, the details of that single authorization rule are returned. If the name of an authorization rule is not provided, a list of all authorization rules for the specified Event Hub is returned. If (Disaster Recovery) Alias name provided, the details of authorization rule of the Namespace for Alias configured is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1.0 - AuthorizationRule for namespace
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Name MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1.1 - AuthorizationRules for namespace
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of all authorization rules in the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.0 - AuthorizationRule for EventHub
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -Name MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which is scoped by the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.1 - AuthorizationRules for EventHub
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets list authorization rules in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which is scoped by the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.0 - AuthorizationRule for Alias (GeoRecovery Configuration)
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AliasName MyAliasNameName -Name MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.1 -AuthorizationRules for Alias (GeoRecovery Configuration)
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AliasName MyAliasNameName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of all authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of a specified Event Hubs consumer group, or gets a list of consumer groups in an Event Hub.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Hubs consumer group, or a list of consumer groups in a given Event Hub. If the name of a consumer group is provided, the details of a single consumer group details are returned. If the name of a consumer group is not provided, a list of consumer groups in the specified Event Hub is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Determine the maximum number of ConsumerGroups to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Determine the maximum number of ConsumerGroups to return.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -ConsumerGroupName MyConsumerGroupName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the consumer group `MyConsumerGroupName` in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which exists in the namespace `MyNamespaceName` with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of consumer groups in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which exists in the namespace `MyNamespaceName` with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Alias(Disaster Recovery configuration) for primary or secondary namespace
The Get-AzureRmEventHubGeoDRConfiguration Retrieves Alias(Disaster Recovery configuration) for primary or secondary namespace

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameters: InputObject (ByValue)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubGeoDRConfiguration -ResourceGroupName "SampleResourceGroup" -Namespace "SampleNamespace_Primary" -Name "SampleDRCongifName"
Name : SampleDRCongifName Id : /subscriptions/{SubscriptionId}/resourceGroups/SampleResourceGroup/providers/Microsoft.EventHub/namespaces/SampleNamespace_Primary/disasterRecoveryConfigs/SampleDRCongifName Type : Microsoft.EventHub/Namespaces/disasterrecoveryconfigs ProvisioningState : Accepted PartnerNamespace : SampleNamespace_Secondary AlternateName : Role : Primary PendingReplicationOperationsCount : 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves alias "SampleDRCongifName" configuration for primary namespace "SampleNamespace_Primary"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the primary key details of the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.
The Get-AzureRmEventHubKey cmdlet returns Primary and Secondary connectionstrings and keys details of the specified NameSpace/Event Hubs/Alias authorization rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Namespace
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 - EventHub
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets details of Primary and Secondary connectionstrings and keys for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3 - Alias (GeoRecovery Configuration)
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AliasName MyAliasName -Name MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets details of Primary, Secondary, AliasPrimary and AliasSecondary connectionstrings and keys for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an Event Hubs namespace, or gets a list of all Event Hubs namespaces in the current Azure subscription.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Hubs namespace, or a list of all Event Hubs namespaces in the current Azure subscription. If the namespace name is provided, the details of a single Event Hubs namespace is returned. If the namespace name is not provided, a list of namespaces is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the details of namespace `MyNamespaceName` in the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Event Hub.
The New-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet creates a new Azure Event Hub. To create Eventhub with Capture description properties, please follow the below steps (Examples 2).

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Create new EventHub
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Event Hub named `MyEventHubName` with a 3-day message retention period and two partitions, in the `WestUS` location, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2 Update Eventhub with 'CaptureDescription'
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName -MessageRetentionInDays 3 -PartitionCount 2
PS C:\> $CreatedEventHub = Get-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName
PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.EventHub.Models.CaptureDescriptionAttributes
PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Enabled = $true PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.IntervalInSeconds = 120 PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Encoding = "Avro" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.SizeLimitInBytes = 10485763 PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.Name = "EventHubArchive.AzureBlockBlob" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.BlobContainer = "container" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.ArchiveNameFormat = "{Namespace}/{EventHub}/{PartitionId}/{Year}/{Month}/{Day}/{Hour}/{Minute}/{Second}" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.StorageAccountResourceId = "/subscriptions/{SubscriptionId}/resourceGroups/MyResourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.ClassicStorage/storageAccounts/arjunteststorage" PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName -InputObject MyCreatedEventHub -messageRetentionInDays 4 -partitionCount 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Event Hub named `MyEventHubName` with a 3-day message retention period, 2 partitions and CaptureDescription properties in the `WestUS` location, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Event Hubs authorization rule for namespace or eventhub.
The New-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet creates a new Event Hubs authorization rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -Rights @("Listen","Send")

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` granting Listen and Send rights to the namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -Rights @("Listen","Send")

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` granting Listen and Send rights to the Event Hub `MyEventHubName` in namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new consumer group for the specified Event Hub.
Creates a new consumer group for the specified Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -ConsumerGroupName MyConsumerGroupName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates the consumer group `MyConsumerGroupName` in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, scoped to the namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

The New-AzureRmEventHubGeoDRConfiguration cmdlet Creates a new Alias(Disaster Recovery configuration)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubGeoDRConfiguration -ResourceGroupName "SampleResourceGroup" -Namespace "SampleNamespace_Primary" -Name "SampleDRCongifName" -PartnerNamespace "SampleNamespace_Secondary"
Name : SampleDRCongifName Id : /subscriptions/{SubscriptionId}/resourceGroups/SampleResourceGroup/providers/Microsoft.EventHub/namespaces/SampleNamespace_Primary/disasterRecoveryConfigs/SampleDRCongifName Type : Microsoft.EventHub/Namespaces/disasterrecoveryconfigs ProvisioningState : Accepted PartnerNamespace : SampleNamespace_Secondary Role : Primary

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an alias "SampleDRCongifName" with primary namespace "SampleNamespace_Primary" with secondary namespace "SampleNamespace_Secondary"

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new primary or secondary key for the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.
The New-AzureRmEventHubKey cmdlet regenerates the primary or secondary SAS key for the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: A base64-encoded 256-bit key for signing and validating the SAS token.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1.1 - Namespace - AuthorizationRule PrimaryKey
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyAuthRuleName -RegenerateKey PrimaryKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerates the primary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1.2 - EventHub - AuthorizationRule PrimaryKey
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -EventHub MyEventHubName -Name MyAuthRuleName -RegenerateKey PrimaryKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerates the primary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.1 - Namespace - AuthorizationRule SecondaryKey
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyAuthRuleName -RegenerateKey SecondaryKey

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.2 - EventHub - AuthorizationRule SecondaryKey
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -EventHub MyEventHubName -Name MyAuthRuleName -RegenerateKey SecondaryKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerates the secondary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified Event Hub.
The Remove-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet removes and deletes the specified Event Hub from the given namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifying this will return true if the command was successful.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifying this will return true if the command was successful.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifying this will return true if the command was successful.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameters: InputObject (ByValue)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.1 - InputObject - Using Variable:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $inputobject = Get-AzureRmEventHub <params> PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHub -InputObject $inputobject

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.2 - InputObject Using Piping:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHub <params> | Remove-AzureRmEventHub

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.1 - ResourceId - Using Variable:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $resourceid = Get-AzureRmEventHub <params> PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceId $resourceid.Id

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.1 - ResourceId - Using string:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceId "/subscriptions/xxxx-xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxx/resourceGroups/ResourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.EventHub/namespaces/NamespaceName/eventhubs/EventHubName"

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified Event Hub authorization rule.
The Remove-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet removes and deletes the specified authorization rule from the given Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` from the Namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -EventHub MyEventHubName -Name MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` from the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameters: InputObject (ByValue)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Name MyNamespaceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.1 - InputObject - Using Variable:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $inputObject = Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace <params> PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -InputObject $inputObject

command:example.maml:title: Example 2.1 - InputObject - Using Piping:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace <params> | Remove-AzureRmEventHubNamespace

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.1 - ResourceId - Using Variable
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $resourceid = Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace <params> PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceId $resourceid.Id

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.2 - ResourceId - Using Piping:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmResource -ResourceType Microsoft.EventHub/Namespaces | Remove-AzureRmEventHubNamespace

command:example.maml:title: Example 3.3 - ResourceId - Using String:
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceId "/subscriptions/xxx-xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxx/resourceGroups/ResourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.EventHub/namespaces/NamespaceName"

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified Event Hub.
The Set-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet updates the properties of the specified Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $CreatedEventHub = Get-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Commands.EventHub.Models.PSCaptureDescriptionAttributes PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Enabled = $true PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.IntervalInSeconds = 120 PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Encoding = "Avro" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.SizeLimitInBytes = 10485763 PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.Name = "EventHubArchive.AzureBlockBlob" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.BlobContainer = "container" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.ArchiveNameFormat = "{Namespace}/{EventHub}/{PartitionId}/{Year}/{Month}/{Day}/{Hour}/{Minute}/{Second}" PS C:\> $createdEventHub.CaptureDescription.Destination.StorageAccountResourceId = "/subscriptions/{SubscriptionId}/resourceGroups/MyResourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.ClassicStorage/storageAccounts/arjunteststorage" PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName -InputObject MyCreatedEventHub -messageRetentionInDays 4 -partitionCount 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the Event Hub `MyEventHubName` represented by the `MyCreatedEventHub` object, setting the message retention period to 4 days, the number of partitions to 2 and CaptureDescription properties

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Namespace MyNamespaceName -Name MyEventHubName -InputObject MyCreatedEventHub -messageRetentionInDays 4 -partitionCount 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the Event Hub `MyEventHubName` represented by the `MyCreatedEventHub` object, setting the message retention period to 4 days, and the number of partitions to 2.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified authorization rule on an Event Hub.
The Set-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet updates the specified authorization rule on the given Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameters: InputObject (ByValue)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -Rights @("Manage")

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` to grant Manage rights to the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, scoped by the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified Event Hubs consumer group.
The Set-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup cmdlet updates the specified Event Hubs consumer group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -ConsumerGroupName MyConsumerGroupName -UserMetadata "Testing"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the user metadata of the consumer group `MyConsumerGroupName` to "Testing."

maml:description.maml:para: This operation disables the Disaster Recovery and stops replicating changes from primary to secondary namespaces

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureRmEventHubGeoDRConfigurationFailOver -ResourceGroupName "SampleResourceGroup" -Namespace "SampleNamespace_Secondary" -Name "SampleDRCongifName"

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified Event Hubs namespace.
The Set-AzureRmEventHubNamespace cmdlet updates the properties of the specified Event Hubs namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Upper limit of throughput units when AutoInflate is enabled, value should be within 0 to 20 throughput units.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Upper limit of throughput units when AutoInflate is enabled, value should be within 0 to 20 throughput units.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Location "WestUS" -State Created

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the state of namespace `MyNamespaceName` to Created .

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Location "WestUS" -State Created -EnableAutoInflate -MaximumThroughputUnits 10

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the state of namespace `MyNamespaceName` with AutoInflate = enabled and MaximumThroughputUnits = 10

maml:description.maml:para: Checks the Availability of the given NameSpace Name or Alias (DR Configuration Name)
The Test-AzureRmEventhubName Cmdlet Check Availability of the NameSpace Name or Alias (DR Configuration Name)

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Test-AzureRmEventhubName -Namespace MyNameSapceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the status on availability of the namespace name 'MyNameSapceName' as True if available

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Test-AzureRmEventhubName -Namespace MyNameSapceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the status on availability of the namespace name 'MyNameSapceName' as False with Reason

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Test-AzureRmEventhubName -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -Namespace Test123 -AliasName myAliasName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the status on availability of the alias name 'myAliasName' for namespace 'MyNameSapceName' as True if available
